Title: Junior Credit & Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di un Junior Credit Analyst da inserire nel nostro team: la persona ideale è laureata in Statistica, Economia, Matematica o Informatica e possiede una buona capacità di programmazione.




Il candidato lavorerà all'interno della Direzione Centrale Crediti nel team che si occupa di modelli statistici, processi e strategie finalizzate ad un’efficace gestione del credito.




Requisiti fondamentali saranno un'ottima conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione tra i seguenti (SAS, Python, R), una buona conoscenza di SQL.




Completano il profilo un'ottima capacità di organizzazione, l'attitudine al problem solving, la capacità di lavorare per obiettivi ed una buona propensione al lavoro in team.




Costituirà titolo preferenziale una pregressa esperienza di massimo 2 anni in società del settore finanziario/consulenza finanziaria/istituti di pagamento e la conoscenza di modelli ML / AI.




Sede di lavoro: Milano.







Per le aziende del Gruppo Mediobanca la diversità e l’inclusività sono valori fondamentali. Le persone interessate verranno considerate nel rispetto della diversità, valorizzando differenti caratteristiche di età, cultura, abilità e orientamento o espressione di genere.

Title: Junior - Data Analyst
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilità

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l’opportunità di aiutare i clienti, la società, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide più attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team è un team all’avanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l’opportunità di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacità di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell’informativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle società identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.

Starting date: Settembre 2025

Tipologia di inserimento: Apprendistato

Ufficio: Milano

Nello specifico ti occuperai di:


Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull’utilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunità è perfetta per te se:


Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l’area del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all’interno di un Network Internazionale


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversità
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creatività e il lavoro di squadra
Modalità di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualità innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better – I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualità, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunità, integrità: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all’impegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformità del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversità e l’Inclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parità di genere. All’interno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunità.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Responsibilities

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG’s innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors – through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training – developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies’ IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.

Starting date: September 2025

Type of contract : Apprenticeship

Office: Milan

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network


Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.


Together for Better – Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

Thanks to our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which attests to the compliance of our Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125 certification, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find a summary of all the actions we are taking on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - “GDPR”), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG’s privacy policy .

KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
L’Open Banking è il nostro DNA!




Centrico ha le sue radici nelle rivoluzioni tecnologiche guidate dal gruppo Sella e dal 2019 è una realtà indipendente: creiamo innovazione per il mondo delle banche e della finanza con un sistema informativo aperto, veloce, modulabile e conveniente.




Il nostro obiettivo è diventare una data driven company!

Per vincere questa sfida, la persona che cerchiamo farà parte dell’area Data Management di Centrico in qualità di Data Analyst e si occuperà di analizzare i dati per fornire insights utili a supporto dei processi decisionali interni al Gruppo.




Responsabilità:

Analizzerai grandi quantità di dati per identificare trend, pattern e insights utili
Creerai report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati in modo chiaro e comprensibile
Collaborerai con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per comprendere le esigenze di analisi dei dati e fornire soluzioni data-driven
Supporterai l’individuazione di regole e di livelli di controllo dell'accesso ai dati
Contribuirai al miglioramento continuo della piattaforma dati del Gruppo tramite l’implementazione di best practice e standard di settore




Requisiti:

Esperienza di almeno 4 anni nel medesimo ruolo o in ruolo affine
Laurea in discipline STEM
Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati (es. SQL, Python, R)
Buona conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione dati (es. Power BI, Tableau)
Ottime capacità relazionali sia verso interlocutori tecnici sia di business
Spiccate capacità analitiche e di problem solving




Nice to have:

Esperienza con tecnologie di big data (es. Hadoop, Spark)
Conoscenza di tecniche di machine learning e data mining
Esperienza con strumenti di ETL (es. Talend, Informatica)
Certificazioni professionali in ambito data analysis (es. Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate)
Conoscenza di metodologie Agile e Scrum




Cosa offriamo:

Un ambiente positivo e in cui il tuo contributo venga apprezzato, la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
Piattaforma e-learning Microsoft: per non smettere mai di imparare e di certificarti
Attività di engagement (tornei di Beach Volley, Padel, Calcetto) e di volontariato aziendale
Contratto con CCNL del Credito
Cura della persona anche con la polizza sanitaria - per te e il tuo nucleo familiare - e polizza TCM
Supporto al benessere psicologico attraverso Stimulus, uno sportello esterno di ascolto a disposizione dei colleghi e dei loro famigliari
Uno sguardo al tuo futuro attraverso il contributo aziendale al fondo pensione
Policy di lavoro flessibile




Sede di lavoro: Milano o Torino o Biella con modalità ibrida.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!




Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?




At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.




WHO ARE WE ?




Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.




We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.




YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST




As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.




WHO YOU ARE




You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

Master’s degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus




WHAT’S HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?




Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:

Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community




"With Cleeven, become who you are!"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
FREELANCE: Data-Expert met business skills




Are you a meticulous individual passionate about ensuring data quality and governance? Do you have an affinity for shaping the way information is managed and presented in today's dynamic business landscape? If the challenge of streamlining and refining both structured and unstructured data resonates with you, then our Data Steward role might just be the opportunity you're looking for!




Our client is embarking on a mission to harness the power of information. We're on the lookout for a dedicated Data Steward to steer this initiative, ensuring structured and unstructured data remains accurate, relevant, and consistent. This position goes beyond mere oversight; it involves a diverse range of responsibilities, from resolving information incidents to setting quality benchmarks, thereby integrating you with various departments across the organization.




What's in it for you?

A unique opportunity to deepen your skills in information management and governance
Thrive in a role that places you at the heart of data quality and lifecycle processes
Establish a significant and enduring impact within a large corporate
Enjoy the flexibility of 2 remote work days per week
Long-term contract and assignment




What you'll do

Champion information governance and be a pivotal voice in crucial councils
Efficiently address and rectify information incidents, upholding supreme quality standards
Dictate the rhythm of the information lifecycle, from its inception to its eventual archiving
Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders, imparting knowledge on information-centric best practices
Authenticate the integrity of the information model, managing inquiries and validations
Cultivate and enhance the internal information ecosystem




Who you are

Must-haves:

Solid experience in information management or a role of similar nature
An analytical prowess complemented by effective problem-solving skills
Proficiency in understanding information classification, its lifecycle, and overarching governance
Strong communication abilities, both in written and spoken forms, in Dutch and English
A genuine passion for continuous improvement and learning




Nice-to-haves:

An academic background in Information Management, Data Science, or related fields
Acquaintance with contemporary data tools and applications







This role is open to both freelancers and people seeking a role as a consultant on recurv's payroll. If this role excites you, don't hesitate – apply or connect with us!

Title: Data analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Systèmes d'information, nous sommes à la recherche d'un Data Analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale au sein du groupe Data Analytics sera de modéliser, interpréter et valoriser les données dans un environnement technologique en pleine évolution. Il prendra en charge les développements et la maintenance des produits de reporting pour plusieurs domaines d’activités de Rolex et/ou Tudor. Il sera le principal interlocuteur de nos répondants métiers sur ce(s) domaine(s).

Responsabilités


Analyser et interpréter les données pour en extraire des insights stratégiques et opérationnels, contribuant directement aux activités de Rolex et Tudor
Produire des sources de données et des visualisations avec des outils de premier plan tels que Tableau et Power BI, afin de faciliter la prise de décision
Optimiser ces produits pour garantir une expérience utilisateur conforme aux attentes
Participer activement à l'amélioration de la qualité des données et garantir la fiabilité des analyses
Contribuer à l'automatisation et à l'optimisation des processus analytiques, avec une compréhension approfondie des outils de transformation de données
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes de data engineering pour garantir l'intégrité et la pertinence des données utilisées dans les analyses
Assister activement la communauté des Data Citizens dans l'élaboration de produits de données qualitatifs, réutilisables et innovants via des communications, accompagnements et formations des utilisateurs


Profil


Formation supérieure en informatique ou ingénierie EPF ou HES, avec une spécialisation en analyse de données
Expérience significative dans des postes de Data Engineer et/ou Data Analyst, acquise dans des environnements OnPrem et Cloud
Langue maternelle française avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais
Maîtrise de technologies telles que Snowflake, Dataiku, BW4Hana Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse ou Talend, pour optimiser le traitement et l'exploitation des données
Bonne maîtrise des outils de visualisation tels que Tableau et Power BI
Forte culture de l'automatisation, associée à un engagement envers la qualité des données et l'observabilité pour maintenir un contrôle rigoureux
Bonne connaissance des concepts de sécurité de l'information
Sens du relationnel et force de proposition
Haut degré d'autonomie dans la recherche de solutions, capacité à évaluer la qualité des livrables
Fortes compétences interpersonnelles et capacité à travailler efficacement en équipe


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position


Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools


Qualifications

What we are looking for


3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
Fluency in English mandatory
German is a plus


Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you’ll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You’ll Love


Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
Hybrid work set-up
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-apéros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
Gender-neutral fair-pay
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)


Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Title: Analista Júnior de Dados - Prevenção à Fraude
HTML:
About The Team

Sobre a Shô

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor. Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Modelo de Trabalho

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Qual será a sua missão

Estamos buscando uma (a) analista júnior de dados para apoiar a tomada de decisões relacionadas às iniciativas de prevenção à fraudes. Com a orientação do gestor, esse profissional ajudará a propor abordagens criativas, buscar dados e interpretar informações estatísticas para responder questões complexas e gerar insumos importantes para as discussões do time.

Job Description

Como será o seu dia a dia

  • Estruturar e conduzir análises de dados para apoiar a construção de novas regras e modelos de fraude ou propor mudanças nas regras e modelos existentes;
  • Construir análises de impacto para justificar a implementação de novas funcionalidades que possam melhorar nossas defesas contra fraude;
  • Estruturar, construir e manter dashboards para acompanhar ativamente as perdas por fraude e identificar riscos potenciais;
  • Apoiar o gerente na criação de apresentações impactantes para comunicar efetivamente as principais descobertas dentro de seu escopo;

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
A SulAmérica há mais de 125 anos se dedica a entregar Saúde Integral para mais de 7 milhões de clientes por meio de produtos e serviços de Saúde, Odonto, Vida, Previdência e Investimentos. Temos como missão melhorar a vida das pessoas, oferecendo apoio, segurança e autonomia em cada momento e decisão de saúde física, emocional e financeira. Para isso, contamos com mais de 4 mil colaboradores(as) engajados(as) e comprometidos(as).

Acreditamos que por meio da inclusão e da diversidade construímos um ambiente seguro e de pertencimento que valoriza e respeita as pessoas integralmente. Assim, incentivamos a candidatura de pessoas com deficiência, de diferentes raças e etnias, gêneros, orientações sexuais, identidades de gênero e gerações para todas as nossas vagas.




Estamos em busca de profissionais para se juntar à nossa equipe de Analista de Performance Negócios SR.




Se você gosta de desafios e tem experiência na atuação com Analista de Performance Negócios SR, esta é a oportunidade ideal para você mostrar o seu diferencial!




O que o(a) Analista de Performance Negócios SR faz na SulA:

Trata e analisa grandes conjuntos de dados para identificar padrões, tendências e anomalias que

possam indicar atividades de fraude ou abuso.

Trabalha em estreita colaboração com a equipe de combate à fraude para compartilhar

informações, relatar descobertas e auxiliar em investigações.

Apresenta resultados por meio de visualizações de dados, como gráficos / dashboards, para

tornar as informações acessíveis e compreensíveis para a equipe de combate à fraude.

Garanti a segurança e a privacidade dos dados utilizados nas análises, cumprindo os regulamentos

de proteção de dados.

Cria análises estatísticos e modelos para detecção de fraude/abuso ou má utilização do plano.

Documenta descobertas e resultados de análises em relatórios que podem ser usados para investigações, auditorias e relatórios de status.

Entre outras atividades.




Requisitos necessários:

Formação superior concluída em Economia, Estatística, Matemática, Engenharia, Ciências Atuariais ou áreas correlatas.

Habilidade em manipulação de grandes bases de dados;

Necessário experiência em Análise de dados;

Domínio em SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, PostgreSQL);

Experiência com Google BigQuery

Experiência com ferramentas de visualização de dados para reportar dados e conduzir insights (Looker Studio, Power BI);

Habilidade de transformar dados complexos em insights compreensíveis para diversos públicos;

Excel Avançado;

Conhecimento em geração de KPIs;

Familiaridade com linguagens de programação usadas na análise de dados, como Rython ou R.

Title: CONTROLLER / DATA ANALYST
HTML:
La Carpoint S.p.A., azienda leader nel settore automobilistico, nell’ambito del potenziamento della propria area Controlling / Data Analytics, ricerca su ROMA un



CONTROLLER / DATA ANALYST



Lo scopo del ruolo è supportare il team di Controllo e Analisi dei Dati nella pianificazione e monitoraggio delle performance aziendali, analizzando dati commerciali ed economico finanziari, realizzando report periodici attraverso la progettazione e programmazione di strumenti di analisi dati avanzati.



Di cosa Ti occuperai?

  • Supportare il responsabile del team, contribuendo all’identificazione, analisi e risoluzione di eventuali anomalie dati nel gestionale aziendale al fine di garantirne l’accuratezza, la coerenza e l’affidabilità;
  • Progettazione, sviluppo e mantenimento di dashboard BI, utili per il monitoraggio del business aziendale.
  • Elaborazione di resoconti e valutazioni delle performance mensili e relativa analisi di redditività delle varie aree aziendali e management;
  • Elaborazione di modelli di previsionali di analisi delle attività, dei processi e dei servizi aziendali che permettano un efficace controllo dei ricavi, dei costi e dei KPI;
  • Sviluppo e analisi ad hoc di strumenti avanzati che permettano il data cleaning, controllo e l’analisi dei dati.



Quali competenze Ti richiediamo?

  • Capacità avanzata di progettazione, realizzazionre e analisi di strumenti di Business Intelligence (per esempio, PowerBI);
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e PowerQuery;
  • Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione DB, data cleaning e data analitics (es. SQL, MySql, Python, DAX, linguaggio M);
  • Conoscenza degli strumenti di misurazione delle performance commerciali e operative, efficacia, efficienza e redditività del business dell’azienda;
  • Competenze analitiche economico-finanziarie-statistiche;
  • Ottime capacità relazionali, precisione, accuratezza, flessibilità, resistenza allo stress, problem solving, orientamento e impegno verso gli obiettivi aziendali.



Requisiti preferenziali

  • Laurea in discipline economiche, ingegneria gestionale o settori affini;
  • Precedente esperienza di 3 anni in mansione analoga all'interno di aziende strutturate.



Cosa offriamo?

Contratto CCNL Commercio con livello e RAL commisurati alla tua effettiva esperienza.
